block.p: A selective listing of state, county and local government events across New Jersey this week. (All dates and times subject to confirmation.) Items should be submitted by mail at least three weeks in advance to the New Jersey Op-Ed Page, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036, or by e-mail to njcivic@nytimes.com.
State of New Jersey

Primary Elections will be held on June 6. Polling places will be open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. Please call your local Board of Elections for your nearest polling place or visit www.njelections.org/loc--officials--doe.html.

Monroe Township High Performance Development Conference presented by the New Jersey Economic Development Authority, the State League of Municipalities and the U.S. Green Building Council New Jersey Chapter. Wednesday from 8:45 a.m to 3:30 p.m. Forsgate Country Club, 375 Forsgate Drive. (609) 695-3481, ext. 18.
Newark Board of Public Utilities. Wednesday at 10 a.m. Board hearing room, eighth floor, Two Gateway Center. (973) 648-3426.
Newark Victims of Crime Compensation Board public hearing. Wednesday at 10 a.m. Victims of Crime Compensation Board, sixth floor, 50 Park Place. (973) 648-4076.
Trenton Board of Education public business meeting. Wednesday at 10 a.m. Department of Education, 100 Riverview Plaza. (609) 292-0739.
Trenton State Budget and Appropriations budget hearings. Monday at 10 a.m. Committee Room 4, first floor, State House Annex Building, 150 West State Street. (609) 292-8030.
Bergen County
Fort Lee Planning Board. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Fort Lee City Hall, 309 Main Street. (201) 592-3727.
Fort Lee City Council. Thursday at 8 p.m. 309 Main Street. (201) 592-3727.
Leonia Environmental Commission. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Borough Hall Annex, 305 Beachwood Place. (201) 592-5741.
Tenafly Board of Adjustment. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Tenafly Town Hall, 100 Riveredge Road. (201) 568-6100.
Essex County
East Orange City Council. Monday at 6:30 p.m. City Hall, 44 City Hall Plaza. (973) 266-5110.
East Orange Alcoholic Beverage Control Board. Wednesday at 5 p.m. City Hall, 44 City Hall Plaza. (973) 266-5486.
Newark Board of Chosen Freeholders conference. Thursday at 7 p.m. Room 506, Hall of Records, 65 Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard. (973) 621-4492.
South Orange Planning Board. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Village Hall, 101 South Orange Avenue. (973) 378-7715 ext. 7725.
Verona Town Council. Monday at 7 p.m. Town Hall, 600 Bloomfield Avenue. (973) 239-9000.
Hudson County
Bayonne Municipal Utilities Authority. Monday at 6 p.m. Municipal Building, 630 Avenue C. (201) 339-3200.
Jersey City Planning Board. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. County Annex Building, 567 Pavonia Avenue. (201) 547-5010.
Jersey City Board of Chosen Freeholders. Thursday at 7 p.m. County Annex Building, 567 Pavonia Avenue. (201) 795-6001.
Hunterdon County
Flemington Youth Services Commission. Wednesday at 3:30 p.m. Hunterdon Justice Complex, Park Avenue. (908) 788-1257.
Flemington Agriculture Development Board. Thursday at 8 p.m. Main Street County Complex, Building 1, Route 12. (908) 788-1490.
Flemington Planning Board. Thursday at 8:15 p.m. Main Street County Complex, Building 1, Route 12. (908) 788-1490.
Mercer County
Trenton Board of Chosen Freeholders. Thursday at 6:30 p.m. McDade Administration Building, 640 South Broad Street. (609) 989-6584.
Middlesex County
New Brunswick Personal Assistance Services Program Advisory Council. Wednesday at 6 p.m. Middlesex County Administration Building, 75 Bayard Street. (732) 745-4013.
Morris County
Morristown County Board of Public Transportation. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. 30 Schuyler Place (973) 829-8101 .
Ocean County
Toms River Planning Board. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Planning, Roads and Engineering Annex, 129 Hooper Avenue. (732) 929-2054.
Passaic County
Wayne CPR class, in two 4-hour sessions. Tickets: $40. Monday and Thursday from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. Wayne Health Department, 475 Valley Road. (973) 694-1800 ext. 3241.
Wayne Township Council. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Wayne Town Hall, 475 Valley Road. (973) 694-1800.
Union County
Bridgewater Recycle Electronic Equipment and Automobile Tires. June 10, from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Newtech Recycling Facility, Building 2, 111 Chimney Rock Road. (908) 654-9889.
Elizabeth City Council Pre-Meeting Conference. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. City Hall, 50 Winfield Scott Plaza. (908) 820-4000.
Elizabeth Board of Chosen Freeholders. Thursday at 7 p.m. Administration Building, 10 Elizabethtown Plaza. (908) 527-4140.
